channel.title: Need help with server
channel.description:
ok so basically... 562's blow -.- lol anyways my problem is im tryna get my server up and running and its just... not working -.- so the server its self is ok Port Status: Open! Port 43594 is open on 50.**.**.*** not adverting here which is why im *ing out the name
server name port owner revision uptime downtime status mypkspot.*****.*** 43594 zack 562 100% 0% Online
so like idk when i try and load my client (source uses khans ip changer but tried more then 1) it will let me connect to 127.0.0.1 but not my servers ip.. any idea why??? there is an exception for it in windows firewall too I load my server first i load my client 2nd thanks in advance!
[Changed the topic, you're not allowed to pay for help -- Evil_]

i used an automatic port forwarder and i checked it with portforward.com port checker tool it says its open and my firewall has an exception for 43594 so idk

item.title: Need help with server
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“mawang, post:1, topic:383513”]Ok, first off, my paypal email is: dragonk520@gmail.com

here is the solution:

your server is being hosted on mypkspot..; however, you, on your own computer, uses the ip address: 127.0.0.1. When you are on your own computer, you do not need to input the literal address of your server. this is because the computer you are on automatically realizes that the host is mypkspot.., but it knows it on the ip address 127.0.0.1. Other people connect to mypkspot.**., you connect to 127.0.0.1.

Also, one thing I never knew when I first started out is that your server needs to be running when people connect to it. aka: you need to open the run.bat and keep it open while you want people to play.

please send money sooner than latr.[/quote]

The fact you’ve just dished out help like that and expect to be paid for it, is pathetic.

@topic: If the CMD isn’t running you need to look at a number of ways, does it say anything on the CMD when you try to connect? Or does it say nothing? If it says something then the server is rejecting the clients connection. If it says nothing then you need to re-read this:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

You need to ensure no ports are blocking it, and that they are connecting through your NO-IP. 127.0.0.1 is a bounce back address which only YOU can use to connect to your server (as is localhost). Look at this as well,

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic

Anyways, the problem is most likely due to a forwarding issue. Make sure that the port is open in your modem and directs to your computer’s local IP.
